intro: Phitopis sterculioides, commonly known as the African milk tree, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody stem and milky sap. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a waxy texture. The flowers are small, clustered in umbels, and usually have five petals with a distinctive corona.
